content.question: Which of the following is equivalent to <math alttext="the integral from, 2 to 3, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x squared, minus 4 x, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from, negative 4 to negative 3, of, the fraction 1 over u, end fraction, d u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>u</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>u</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 2 to 3, of, the fraction 1 over x, end fraction, d x, times, the integral from, 2 to 3, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x minus 4, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one fourth, times the integral from, 2 to 3, of, the fraction 1 over x, end fraction, d x, minus, one fourth times, the integral from, 2 to 3, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x minus 4, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one fourth, times the integral from, 2 to 3, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x minus 4, end fraction, d x, minus, one fourth times, the integral from, 2 to 3, of, the fraction 1 over x, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one fourth, times the integral from, 2 to 3, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x minus 4, end fraction, d x, minus, one fourth times, the integral from, 2 to 3, of, the fraction 1 over x, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
